trans-unit.source: Represents a Windows icon, which is a small bitmap image that is used to represent an object.
Icons can be thought of as transparent bitmaps, although their size is determined by the system.
You can construct <xref:System.Drawing.Icon> objects from files, streams, or embedded resources.
For a list of constructors, see <xref:System.Drawing.Icon.%23ctor%2A>.
You can also convert an <xref:System.Drawing.Icon> to a bitmap by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Icon.ToBitmap%2A> method.
An icon resource can contain multiple icon images.
One icon file may contain images in several sizes and color depths.
The image that is used in an application depends on the operating system and settings.
The following list details the typical sizes for an icon:
16 pixels x 16 pixels
32 pixels x 32 pixels
48 pixels x 48 pixels
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class from the specified data stream.
An icon resource can contain multiple icon images.
One icon file may contain images in several sizes and color depths.
The image that is used in an application depends on the operating system and settings.
The following list details the typical sizes for an icon:
16 pixels x 16 pixels
32 pixels x 32 pixels
48 pixels x 48 pixels
This constructor returns the smallest image that is contained in the specified stream.
The data stream from which to load the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
The stream parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class from the specified file name.
An icon resource can contain multiple icon images.
One icon file may contain images in several sizes and color depths.
The image that is used in an application depends on the operating system and settings.
The following list details the typical sizes for an icon:
16 pixels x 16 pixels
32 pixels x 32 pixels
48 pixels x 48 pixels
This constructor returns the smallest image that is contained in the specified file.
The file to load the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> from.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class and attempts to find a version of the icon that matches the requested size.
If a version cannot be found that exactly matches the size, the closest match is used.
If the `original` parameter is an <xref:System.Drawing.Icon> that has a single size, this method only creates a duplicate icon.
Use the stretching capabilities of the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawImage%2A> method to resize the icon.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> from which to load the newly sized icon.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> structure that specifies the height and width of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
The original parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class of the specified size from the specified stream.
The stream that contains the icon data.
The desired size of the icon.
The stream is `null` or does not contain image data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class of the specified size from the specified file.
If the specified file does not contain an image that matches the desired size, the icon that has the closest size is returned.
The `fileName` should include the complete path if it is not in the current application directory.
The name and path to the file that contains the icon data.
The desired size of the icon.
The string is `null` or does not contain image data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class from a resource in the specified assembly.
This constructor creates an <xref:System.Drawing.Icon> from a resource with the name specified by the `resource` parameter in the assembly that contains the type specified by the `type` parameter.
This constructor combines the namespace of the given type together with the string name of the resource and looks for a match in the assembly manifest.
For example you can pass in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> type and `Error.ico` to this constructor, and it looks for a resource that is named `System.Windows.Forms.Error.ico`.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that specifies the assembly in which to look for the resource.
The resource name to load.
An icon specified by resource cannot be found in the assembly that contains the specified type.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class and attempts to find a version of the icon that matches the requested size.
If a version cannot be found that exactly matches the size, the closest match is used.
If the `original` parameter is an <xref:System.Drawing.Icon> that has a single size, this method only creates a duplicate icon.
Use the stretching capabilities of the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawImage%2A> method to resize the icon.
The icon to load the different size from.
The width of the new icon.
The height of the new icon.
The original parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class from the specified data stream and with the specified width and height.
The data stream from which to load the icon.
The width, in pixels, of the icon.
The height, in pixels, of the icon.
The stream parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> class with the specified width and height from the specified file.
If the specified file does not contain an image that matches the desired height and width, the icon that has the closest size is returned.
The `fileName` should include the complete path if it is not in the current application directory.
The name and path to the file that contains the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> data.
The desired width of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
The desired height of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
The string is `null` or does not contain image data.
Clones the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>, creating a duplicate image.
An object that can be cast to an <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
Releases all resources used by this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
Calling `Dispose` allows the resources that are used by this <xref:System.Drawing.Icon> to be reallocated for other purposes.
Returns an icon representation of an image that is contained in the specified file.
A relative path is assumed to be relative to the current working directory.

When <xref:System.Drawing.Icon.ExtractAssociatedIcon%2A> is used with bitmaps, a thumbnail image may be returned instead of an icon if the system that is running the application has a registry setting that causes bitmap files to be shown as thumbnail images.
The path to the file that contains an image.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> representation of the image that is contained in the specified file.
The filePath does not indicate a valid file.
-or-
The filePath indicates a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path.
Allows an object to try to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.
Creates a GDI+ <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> from the specified Windows handle to an icon (`HICON`).
When using this method, you must dispose of the original icon by using the `DestroyIcon` method in the Win32 API to ensure that the resources are released.
A Windows handle to an icon.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> this method creates.
Gets the Windows handle for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
This is not a copy of the handle; do not free it.
The Windows handle for the icon.
Gets the height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
The height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
Saves this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> to the specified output <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> to save to.
Gets the size of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> structure that specifies the width and height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
Converts this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> to a GDI+ <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The transparent areas of the icon are lost when it is converted to a bitmap, and the transparent color of the resulting bitmap is set to `RGB(13,11,12)`.
The returned bitmap has the same height and width as the original icon.
Beginning with framework version 4.6 support was added for PNG frames in .ico files.

Applications that target earlier versions of the framework but are running on the 4.6 bits can opt in into the new behavior by adding the following line to the `<runtime>` section of the app.config file:`<AppContextSwitchOverrides value="Switch.System.Drawing.DontSupportPngFramesInIcons=false" />`
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> that represents the converted <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
Gets a human-readable string that describes the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
A string that describes the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
Gets the width of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
The width of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data that is required to serialize the target object.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination (see <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>) for this serialization.
